question: where did the word Allah come from
answer:
QUESTION

Where did word "Allah" originate from?, also is it true that non Muslims before Prophet Muhammad (SAW) used  word "Allah" to address to the god(s) they believed in? , and if they did, than who did they refer to as “Allah”, as they worshipped many gods including idles?

ANSWER


Share:

Assalamu Alaikum Warahmatullah

 

Brother/Sister in Islam

 

The word Allah comes from the Arabic word al-ilah, which means ‘divine’.

 

The non Muslim used ‘’Allah’’ to refer to god (Allah), but they committed shirk by believing in many other gods and idols.

 

The book ‘Zabur’ was sent to Dawood (as)

 

If one wants to see the Prophet (saw) his dream, then he should recite Daruud shareef frequently, and follow his Sunnah.

 

This is the command of Allah and Shariah. We do not understand the wisdom and making tawaaf 7 times. It is the spirit of a mu’min to accept the laws of Allah whether we understand the reason or not

 

And Allah Knows Best

 

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
